title: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
description: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting downWindows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
OB: When shutting down the computer without saving the dirty .txt file in a WSWB session, there is no warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their changes.
EB: When shutting down the computer without saving the dirty .txt file in a WSWB session, a warning or question message box should appear to give users a chance to save their changes.
SR:
1. Open WSWB
2. Create a new project
3. Create a text file in the project
4. Add a line of text to the text file
5. Confirm that the text file is marked as dirty
6. Left click on the Windows Start menu
7. Select the 'Shut Down' command to shut down/reboot the computer
8. Note the absence of a warning or question message box

Expected: A warning or question message box should appear to give users a chance to save their changes before shutting down the computer.
